textbooks.title: Introduction to Robotics: Mechanics and Control
textbooks.author: Craig

grading.policies: Grades will be based on class participation, problem sets, online quizzes, virtual labs, final project, and group participation.

assignments.name: Problem Sets
assignments.description: Five problem sets consisting of textbook-style example problems.

assignments.name: Virtual Labs
assignments.description: Three group assignments requiring various tasks and analysis.

assignments.name: Final Project
assignments.description: Group assignment with elaborate objectives and solution-freedom.

policies.attendance: Attendance during live, synchronous course meetings will factor into the class participation portion of term grades. Students receive one 'free' session they may miss without any grading impact.
policies.late_work: Unless agreed upon with the professor in advance, assignments received late may incur a 50% penalty. Late submissions will generally not be accepted after solutions are posted.
policies.academic_integrity: Students must adhere to the Stevens Honor System and the Graduate Student Code of Academic Integrity.
policies.accommodations: Students with documented disabilities must communicate with the professor to coordinate accommodations.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer skills, live web conferencing using Zoom, and MATLAB programming skills are required.
additional_info.support_resources: Contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) for support.

_metadata.course_description: This course introduces students to a breadth of foundational topics relevant to robotic manipulators and mobile robots.
learning_outcomes: Apply mathematical foundations relevant for describing the geometry, motion, and behavior of robotic manipulators and wheeled mobile robots.
Utilize mathematical methods for robot capability analysis and operation.
Use software to perform analyses, generate programming code, and generate simulations for various robotic devices.
prerequisites: Knowledge of differential equations and matrix analysis strongly recommended
Familiarity with fundamentals of computer coding and MATLAB recommended
